title.value: A debriefing tool to acquire non-technical skills in trauma courses
title.justification: The title clearly summarizes the main focus of the paper which is about a debriefing tool for acquiring non-technical skills in trauma courses.
title.quote:
Objective: The study reports the use of a nominal group technique (NGT) to evaluate the PEARLS Healthcare
debriefing tool as a tool to foster non-technical skills in trauma simulation courses. Additionally, it introduces a
debriefing card to be used in trauma courses.

extractions.description: The paper discusses the use of the PEARLS Healthcare Debriefing Tool to enhance non-technical skills in trauma courses. It evaluates this tool using a nominal group technique and suggests that the PEARLS strategies are effective for fostering non-technical skills. The study emphasizes the importance of structured debriefing to improve communication and leadership in trauma settings, proposing a new debriefing card for trauma simulation courses.

type.justification: The study presents practical findings from the use of a nominal group technique to evaluate a debriefing tool, indicating an empirical study.
type.quote: Seven participants participated in the nominal group. Based on the online survey results, the self-assessment debriefing strategy (from PEARLS) was rated 4.83/5 in relevance, the focused facilitation 5/5, and the provision of information 4.5/5.

name.justification: The paper focuses on educational programs and techniques for teaching non-technical skills in medical, particularly trauma, scenarios.
name.quote: Surgical training programs have tended to overlook non-technical skills such as communication and team collaboration, perhaps because the ideal way to teach them is yet to be determined.

name.justification: The research discusses the use of simulation courses to teach non-technical skills.
name.quote:
The PEARLS (Promoting Excellence and Reflective Learning in
Simulation) Healthcare Debriefing Tool [5] has become accepted as a
framework with the potential to promote non-technical skills.
